Bill Gates
Bill Gates Too many people in the U.S. are working hard but still struggling to make ends meet.
 
With rapid advancements in technology, especially in artificial intelligence, we have incredible opportunities to help more low-income Americans get on a path to prosperity and better support the frontline workers who serve them.
 
NextLadder Ventures is an ambitious new organization launched by the Ballmer Group, Stand Together, the Valhalla Foundation, John Overdeck, and the Gates Foundation, with a collective commitment of more than $1 billion to expand economic opportunity for people experiencing poverty across the country.
 
Everyone deserves the opportunity to achieve their ambitions. Weâ€™re excited about whatâ€™s possible to help people live more prosperous lives when bold ideas, deep expertise, and remarkable partners come together. National Philanthropies Join Forces to Advance Economic Mobility and Access to Opportunity in America gatesfoundation.org

Bill Gates
Bill Gates Iâ€™ve entered the startup world againâ€¦

When your daughter asks if youâ€™d be willing to work a shift in customer service at her startup, the only right answer is yes.

Iâ€™ve spent a lot of time thinking about how technology can make systems more efficient, equitable, and accessible. But Iâ€™ve learned over the years that the best way to understand how something works, or where it breaks, is to go straight to the people using it.

Thatâ€™s why Iâ€™ll be joining the Phia customer experience team for a day this week. Phia is a fashion-tech tool built to make shopping smarter and more sustainable, and itâ€™s the brainchild of my daughter Phoebe Gates and her co-founder Sophia Kianni.

Theyâ€™ve built an app and browser extension that helps people shop smarter by finding the best prices, surfacing secondhand options, and showing lower-impact alternatives across thousands of online retailers.

Itâ€™s been inspiring to watch them tackle a massive challenge, rethinking the way we shop, by meeting users where they are.

And now, Iâ€™ll be doing the same.

Looking forward to getting back into the startup scene. Hopefully, I wonâ€™t break anything (no promises).
